verses.text: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished , and all the host of them.
And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made ; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.
And God blessed the seventh day , and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.\f + \fr 2.3 \ft created…: Heb. created to make\f* \p
¶ These \add are\add* the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created , in the day that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God made the earth and the heavens ,

And every plant of the field before it was in the earth , and every herb of the field before it grew : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God had not caused it to rain upon the earth , and \add there was\add* not a man to till the ground.
But there went up a mist from the earth , and watered the whole face of the ground.\f + \fr 2.6 \ft there…: or, a mist which went up from, etc.\f*

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God formed man \add of\add* the dust of the ground , and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life ; and man became a living soul.\f + \fr 2.7 \ft of the dust…: Heb. dust of the ground\f* \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God planted a garden eastward in Eden ; and there he put the man whom he had formed.

And out of the ground made the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight , and good for food ; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden , and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
And a river went out of Eden to water the garden ; and from thence it was parted , and became into four heads.
The name of the first \add is\add* Pison : that \add is\add* it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah , where \add there is\add* gold ;
And the gold of that land \add is\add* good : there \add is\add* bdellium and the onyx stone.
And the name of the second river \add is\add* Gihon : the same \add is\add* it that compasseth the whole land of Ethiopia.\f + \fr 2.13 \ft Ethiopia: Heb. Cush\f*

And the name of the third river \add is\add* Hiddekel : that \add is\add* it which goeth toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river \add is\add* Euphrates.\f + \fr 2.14 \ft toward…: or, eastward to Assyria\f*
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God took the man , and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.\f + \fr 2.15 \ft the man: or, Adam\f* \p
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God commanded the man , saying , Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat :\f + \fr 2.16 \ft thou…: Heb. eating thou shalt eat\f*

But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil , thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.\f + \fr 2.17 \ft thou shalt surely…: Heb. dying thou shalt die\f* \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God said , \add It is\add* not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.\f + \fr 2.18 \ft meet…: Heb. as before him\f*

And out of the ground the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God formed every beast of the field , and every fowl of the air ; and brought \add them\add* unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature , that \add was\add* the name thereof.\f + \fr 2.19 \ft Adam: or, the man\f*
And Adam gave names to all cattle , and to the fowl of the air , and to every beast of the field ; but for Adam there was not found an help meet for him.\f + \fr 2.20 \ft gave: Heb. called\f* \p
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam , and he slept : and he took one of his ribs , and closed up the flesh instead thereof;
And the rib , which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God had taken from man , made he a woman , and brought her unto the man.\f + \fr 2.22 \ft made: Heb. builded\f*

And Adam said , This \add is\add* now bone of my bones , and flesh of my flesh : she shall be called Woman , because she was taken out of Man.\f + \fr 2.23 \ft Woman: Heb. Isha\f*\f + \fr 2.23 \ft Man: Heb. Ish\f*
Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother , and shall cleave unto his wife : and they shall be one flesh.
And they were both naked , the man and his wife , and were not ashamed.
